Congratulations to Jennifer Barker, who will be Piedmont's High School Board Parent Representative for the next two years.

Jennifer Barker grew up in Gaston County and received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Psychology from Appalachian State University. She is wrapping up a two year term as the secondary campus parent board rep, where she served as the co-chair of the Athletic Committee. She was instrumental in finding an alternate venue for the 2019 graduation. She was the Activities Director for Covenant Village Retirement Community for twenty-six years. In 2019, she transitioned to become their Human Resource Director. She has served as the president of the North Carolina Activities Professional Association and the president of the Metrolina Activities Professional Association. Additionally, Mrs. Barker has taught the state-approved Health Care Activities course at Gaston College. Married to Larry Barker, they have two children, Brandon (10th grade) and Danica (9th grade). They are active members at City Church in Gastonia. They are members at Gardner Acres Swim Club.

In honor of Black History Month I want to share a famous african american inventor that everyone should be thankful for. Those who survived either of the World Wars thanks to a gas mask have Garrett Morgan to thank. Morgan, born in 1877 and who had only an elementary education, first created the ‚Äúsafety hood‚Äù to help firefighters navigate smokey buildings, later modifying it to carry its own air supply‚Äî making it the world‚Äôs first effective gas masks in 1914.

He also had the good sense to add a third position to the traffic signal ‚Äî yes, there was a time when traffic signals just said ‚Äústop‚Äù or ‚Äúgo‚Äù ‚Äî an addition that further reduced automobile accidents. He is also famous for several other inventions that we still use today like hair straightening products and improved sewing machines. So what are you waiting for?
